Package mvc.model

Class SimpleStockManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvc.model.SimpleStockManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StockManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdvancedStockManager
    public class SimpleStockManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements StockManager
    The mvc.model.SimpleStockManager class is the model in the MVC architecture of this program. This class handles all calculations and computations and that are then pushed to the view by the controller.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addPortfolio​(java.lang.String name)
      The addPortfolio method allows a user to add a portfolio with a given name to the PortfolioManager.

      The adjustPortfolio method supports the addition and subtraction of stock from a single portfolio.
      protected boolean containsPortfolio​(java.lang.String name)
      The containsPortfolio private method return a boolean value based on whether a given list of portfolios contains a portfolio of a given name.
      protected void earliestDataCheck​(java.time.LocalDate start, int x, java.util.List<StockData> data)
      The earliestDataCheck method ensure that the given date does not try to access data that doesn't exist either because the date itself is before the earliest accessible data, or because the x value goes back before the earliest accessible data.
      protected StockPortfolio find​(java.lang.String name)
      The find method searches this list of portfolios and return the StockPortfolio object of the given name.
      private double getClosingPrice​(java.util.List<StockData> history, java.time.LocalDate date)
      The getClosingPrice method retrieves the closing price of the given date, if the stock market is closed on the given date, it will return the closing price of the next previous stock market day.
      java.util.List<java.time.LocalDate> getCrossovers​(java.lang.String ticker, java.time.LocalDate start, java.time.LocalDate end, int days)
      The getCrossovers method returns the days that are x-day crossovers for a specified stock over a specified date range and x-value.
      protected java.util.List<StockData> getData​(java.lang.String ticker, java.time.LocalDate start, int x)
      The getData method get the history data from a local CSV file by default.

      The getGainLoss method returns the gain or loss on a specified stock over a specified date range.

      The getMovingAvg method returns the x-day moving average of a specified stock on a specified date for a specified number of days.

      The getPortfolioValue method returns the total value of a portfolio of the given name on the given date.
      java.lang.String listPortfolios()
      The listPortfolios method return a list of all the portfolios in the portfolio manager in the form of a string.

      The listStockInPortfolio method returns a list of the stocks in a given portfolio in the form of a string.
      protected java.lang.String portfolioListToString()
      The portfolioListToString method converts a list of StockPortfolio objects to a corresponding string list.

      The removePortfolio method removes a portfolio of the given name from the portfolio manger.

      The trim method trims a list of stocks.StockData to only include those entries corresponding to the date within the range (inclusive).

      • adjustPortfolio

        public void adjustPortfolio​(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String ticker,
                            double shares)
        Description copied from interface: StockManager
        The adjustPortfolio method supports the addition and subtraction of stock from a single portfolio. If a stock is already found in a portfolio, that stock will be updated. Otherwise, a new stock with a given number of shares will be added to the portfolio. If the number of shares of a certain stock reaches 0, that stock will be removed from the portfolio. No stock may have negative shares.
        Specified by:
        adjustPortfolio in interface StockManager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio
        ticker - the stock ticker
        shares - the number of shares to be added

      • find

        protected StockPortfolio find​(java.lang.String name)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The find method searches this list of portfolios and return the StockPortfolio object of the given name. If no matching portfolio is found, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of portfolio to find
        Returns:
        the matching portfolio object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given portfolio is not found

      • getData

        protected java.util.List<StockData> getData​(java.lang.String ticker,
                                            java.time.LocalDate start,
                                            int x)
        The getData method get the history data from a local CSV file by default. If a CSV corresponding to the given ticker is not found, the method will attempt to download a new file from the API. Alternatively if the CSV file does exist but is not up-to-date (i.e. its most recent entry is not today), it is replaced by a new CSV file from the API. This method also checks that the earliest date accessed by the user is not out of range of the accessible data and that the x value for methods like getCrossovers does not reach beyond the earliest data available.
        Parameters:
        ticker - stock ticker
        start - earliest date accessed
        x - x-day value
        Returns:
        the list of StockData

      • getClosingPrice

        private double getClosingPrice​(java.util.List<StockData> history,
                               java.time.LocalDate date)
        The getClosingPrice method retrieves the closing price of the given date, if the stock market is closed on the given date, it will return the closing price of the next previous stock market day.
        Parameters:
        history - the list of stocks.StockData for a given ticker
        date - the desired date
        Returns:
        the closing price on that date

      • trim

        private java.util.List<StockData> trim​(java.util.List<StockData> data,
                                       java.time.LocalDate start,
                                       java.time.LocalDate end)
        The trim method trims a list of stocks.StockData to only include those entries corresponding to the date within the range (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        data - the list of stocks.StockData
        start - the start date
        end - the end date
        Returns:
        the new, trimmed list of stocks.StockData

      • timeCheck

        protected void timeCheck​(java.time.LocalDate start,
                         java.time.LocalDate end)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The timeCheck method ensure that the start date is before or equal to the end date, and that the given date is not in the future.
        Parameters:
        start - start date
        end - end date
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start date is after end date or start date is in the future

      • earliestDataCheck

        protected void earliestDataCheck​(java.time.LocalDate start,
                                 int x,
                                 java.util.List<StockData> data)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The earliestDataCheck method ensure that the given date does not try to access data that doesn't exist either because the date itself is before the earliest accessible data, or because the x value goes back before the earliest accessible data.
        Parameters:
        start - start date
        x - x-value
        data - list of StockData
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the start date or x-value attempts to access a day before the earliest data available.
